alert.note: Alert for Hughes; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 12:47AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Seminole and northwestern Hughes Counties through 115 AM CDT... At 1247 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles east of Seminole, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Seminole, Wewoka, Cromwell, Yeager, and Lima. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 206 and 213. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor NOAA Weather Radio, local radio stations or available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
